resources.string: To get started, search for an address in the field above and tap on the building that will be installed with solar panels.
When you save a project, it will appear here.
Why is this app being developed?
The app helps users calculate the expected electricity production from solar panels based on local climate data, roof conditions, and solar panel efficiency.
How can solar cells work effectively in Norway?

Although one might think solar cells work best in warm climates, they are most effective at around -5°C and perform poorly at temperatures above 25°C. In Southern Norway, solar cells can actually produce more energy than in Africa, as long as there is no snow cover.
Can I get support for solar panel installation?
Enova offers support of up to 32,500 Norwegian kroner for electricity production that can be fed back to the power grid. It is also possible to get support for holiday homes.
Can I trust the calculations in the app?
The app is based on available data and documented calculation models, but values may deviate from actual conditions. It is always recommended to compare the results with multiple sources.
What is the difference between the various panels?

Solar panels and solar roof tiles are the two most common types of solar cells in Norway. Solar panels are mounted on existing roofs and cost between 2,500 and 3,000 kroner per m². They provide slightly more effect per panel than solar roof tiles but often cover a smaller part of the roof surface. Solar roof tiles replace regular roof tiles and cost between 4,000 and 5,000 kroner per m². They are especially beneficial during roof renovation, as they function both as a roof and a solar cell, which can provide a total cost savings. They are also known for a more aesthetic and discreet expression.
Can you install solar panels yourself?

You cannot install solar panels yourself, except in certain cases. We strongly recommend using professionals for larger solar panel systems for homes and cabins connected to the power grid.\n\nThis ensures that the system is correctly installed, without fire and health risks. You can also be confident that the solar cells will function optimally.
When can you install by yourself?

1. It is a standalone solar panel system
2. You are not connected to the power grid
3. The solar panel system is under 50V and 200VA
4. You do not want to apply for Enova support
1. Assess the possibility of a solar cell system

Before installing solar panels, check if it is permitted in your municipality. Some places require an application or have restrictions. Also, ensure that the roof is in good condition and has good sun exposure. A solar cell dealer can help you with the assessment.

Choose a dealer and installer who work together for a smooth process. The dealer will help you find the right solar cell system, and most work with certified installers. This reduces the risk of misunderstandings and conflicts.
The installer first mounts suitable fixtures on the roof, adapted to the material and slope. Then, the solar panels are securely fastened to withstand both strong winds and heavy snow.

The inverter makes the solar energy from your panels usable in your home\'s electrical outlets. The installer places the inverter in a suitable location and draws cables from the panels, which are then connected to the inverter.
